item.description:
Murder, mystery, a twist ending decided by audience members -- Ayn Rand's successful play, Night of January the 16th, contained much to captivate. What better way to break up the long, cold winter ahead than to join us in a reading of this controversial play? Take part and read the play, or sit on the jury and decide our hero's fate. After all, what's more fun than watching a ground-breaking murder mystery play? When you get to decide the verdict and the ending.

Where: Woburn, MA (will e-mail exact location to those who RSVP)
When: January the 16th at 8pm
What: A group of objectivists and Ayn Rand fans getting together to hold a reading of Ayn Rand's controversial and ground-breaking stageplay

If you haven't read the play yet, don't worry; we need a few folks to sit on the "jury" and decide the ending. Everyone else, dust off your copy and your Swedish accent and come
join us to take a part.

Snacks to share are welcome.

We'll have a few extra copies of the play on hand if you need one.

Email me to be added to the guest list and to get the address and directions!

group.name: The Boston Ayn Rand Meetup Group

item.name: Night of January 16th!
